hero.title: I always felt torn growing up between two countries. At 47, I finally feel at peace
hero.description: Age has made me a more fully realized version of myself – I didn’t recognize that until returning to the Philippines

primary.title: Kanlaon Volcano erupts, maintains Alert Level 3
primary.description: Kanlaon Volcano in Negros erupted early Tuesday morning, April 8, producing a massive ash plume and pyroclastic flows, the state volcanology bureau Phivolcs reported.

secondary.title: Kanlaon Volcano erupts anew
secondary.description: The Kanlaon Volcano in Negros Island erupted anew on Tuesday morning, April 8, 2025.The Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (Phivolcs) said the explosive eruption began at 5:51 a.m. and ended at 6:47 a.m.

secondary.title: Disaster agency says over 25k displaced due to Mt. Kanlaon
secondary.description: More than 25,000 residents have been displaced across seven localities in Negros Occidental following the explosive eruption of Mount Kanlaon on the morning of April 8

secondary.title: DSWD provides P132 million in aid to Kanlaon Volcano evacuees
secondary.description: DSWD spokesperson Assistant Secretary Irene Dumlao said the assistance includes family food packs, non-food items, and financial aid.

carousel.title: Defending West Philippine Sea: The abyss separating Duterte, Marcos
carousel.description: Manila, Philippines — Over 90 percent of Filipinos distrust China, according to results of a survey last year by OCTA Research.

carousel.title: Why does Duterte’s war on drugs continue to divide the Philippines?
carousel.description: Rodrigo Duterte is now with the ICC to answer for crimes against humanity, but Filipinos continue to be divided over whether or not he should be held accountable

carousel.title: Filipino women fight for the right to divorce in a deeply Catholic country
carousel.description: 101 East meets the women fighting for the right to end their marriages in the deeply Catholic Philippines.

carousel.title: Dismantling a dynasty: Vico Sotto is redefining local leadership
carousel.description: How did Vico Sotto end the Eusebios’ rule in Pasig City? Can it be done elsewhere? He bears a popular surname and he’s connected to an existing dynasty in Quezon City.
